text: Grevillea zygoloba is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to an area in the Wheatbelt and Goldfields-Esperance regions of Western Australia. The erect shrub typically grows to a height of and has glaucous branchlets. It has dissected subpinnatisect leaves with a blade that is . It blooms between September and November and produces an axillary or terminal raceme irregular inflorescence with white or cream flowers with white styles. Later it forms viscid ellipsoidal glabrous fruit that are long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== zygoloba Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia
title: Grevillea zygoloba
